demographics.name: Maria Garcia
demographics.mobility: Requires walker for ambulation due to L weakness.

diagnosis.primary: Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) - Adenocarcinoma
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Worsening headaches, new onset left-sided weakness, cognitive changes.
diagnosis.baselineStatus: ECOG 2 (Ambulatory and capable of self-care but unable to carry out work activities. Up >50% of waking hours)

treatmentPlan.intent: Palliative - Emergency Treatment (Symptom control, delay neurological progression)
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: None during RT. Systemic: Pembrolizumab (managed by Med Onc).
medications: Dexamethasone 4 mg PO BID (started 03/21/2025 for cerebral edema)

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine, neutral head position, thermoplastic mask for immobilization. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Mask marks aligned to room lasers at external auditory meatus (EAM) or nasion/vertex. Isocenter at L0.0, L0.0, V+2.0 from reference.
ctSimulation.scanner: e.g., Philips Brilliance Big Bore CT
ctSimulation.ctNotes: Non-contrast CT head acquired in treatment position with thermoplastic mask for WBRT planning.

dosimetry.collAngles: 0 (shaped to include whole brain, avoid eyes)
dosimetry.constraints: Lens Max < 8 Gy; Optic Nrv Max < 25 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Standard 10fx WBRT. Emergency treatment for acute neurological symptoms.

fractions.setupNotes: KV imaging for setup verification. Tolerances met.

imagingAndReports.summary: Large RUL mass with mediastinal adenopathy. Suspicious for malignancy.

reportDetails.findings: Large mass measuring approximately 5 cm in the right upper lobe. Associated mediastinal and right hilar adenopathy. Findings suspicious for malignancy.
reportDetails.impression: Right upper lobe mass with regional adenopathy concerning for primary lung cancer.

imagingAndReports.summary: Hypermetabolic RUL mass, mediastinal nodes, and single bone metastasis (T10). SUVmax 12.5 in primary.

reportDetails.findings: Intense FDG uptake within the right upper lobe mass (SUVmax 12.5). Hypermetabolic mediastinal lymph nodes (SUVmax 9.0) and right hilar nodes (SUVmax 8.5). Single focus of increased uptake in the T10 vertebral body (SUVmax 6.0).
reportDetails.impression: Hypermetabolic primary lung malignancy with regional nodal involvement and likely solitary bone metastasis, consistent with Stage IV disease.

imagingAndReports.summary: Multiple enhancing lesions throughout cerebral hemispheres and cerebellum, largest 2.5 cm in right parietal lobe with significant surrounding vasogenic edema. Findings consistent with metastatic disease.

reportDetails.findings: Multiple enhancing lesions identified within both cerebral hemispheres and the cerebellum, consistent with metastatic disease. The largest lesion is in the right parietal lobe measuring 2.5 cm, with significant surrounding vasogenic edema. Smaller lesions measure up to 1 cm.

imagingAndReports.summary: Non-contrast CT head acquired in treatment position with thermoplastic mask for WBRT planning.

reportDetails.procedure: CT simulation for Whole Brain Radiation Therapy (WBRT).
reportDetails.setup: Patient positioned supine in thermoplastic mask, head neutral, arms down.
reportDetails.scanParams: Non-contrast CT scan acquired from vertex through C2 with 3 mm slice thickness.
reportDetails.notes: Patient tolerated procedure. Setup marks placed. Data sent for 3D-CRT planning.

progressNotes.author: Dr. David Roberts (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt called with severe HA and L arm weakness. Urgent MRI Brain ordered, shows multiple mets. Started Dexamethasone 4mg BID. Referred urgently to Radiation Oncology for palliative RT consult. Discussed goals of care. Continue Pembrolizumab for now.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Samuel Green (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt seen urgently for symptomatic brain mets from known NSCLC. MRI confirms multiple lesions with edema. Pt reports slight improvement in HA on steroids, L weakness persists. Discussed palliative WBRT (30 Gy/10fx) vs SRS (not ideal due to number of mets). Goals: improve/stabilize neuro symptoms, QOL. Risks: fatigue, hair loss, potential cognitive effects (discussed in context of palliative goals). Plan: Proceed with WBRT sim today/tomorrow, start RT ASAP. Pt and family agree.

progressNotes.author: Sarah Chen, RTT
progressNotes.summary: CT Sim completed for WBRT. Aquaplast mask made. Patient positioned supine, neutral head position. Tolerated well. Plan to treat with opposed laterals.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Samuel Green (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient completed 5/10 fractions WBRT. Reports significant improvement in headache. Left arm weakness slightly better, able to hold a cup. Mild fatigue. Scalp showing early erythema, advised gentle shampoo. Continue Dexamethasone, plan taper after RT completion. Continue WBRT.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Palliative - improve headache and weakness, control brain disease, improve quality of life.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue (common, may worsen), hair loss (expected, likely permanent), skin redness/irritation on scalp (mild), short-term memory effects possible, steroid side effects (mood changes, increased appetite, high blood sugar, insomnia, fluid retention).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Scalp care (mild shampoo, avoid irritants), sun protection for scalp if hair loss occurs, managing fatigue, report worsening neurological symptoms (headache, weakness, seizures, confusion) immediately.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments, take steroids as prescribed, report symptoms.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Take Dexamethasone with food, adhere to prescribed dose/taper schedule. Continue Pembrolizumab as scheduled by Med Onc.

cptCharges.description: Radiation treatment delivery, 3+ fields or complex (Opposed lats WBRT)
Image Guided RT (IGRT - if used, e.g. kV imaging)
